medical_history.chief_complaint: Gestational diabetes mellitus (GDM) identified during pregnancy.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient's symptoms were first detected during the pregnancy. She was diagnosed at 18 weeks gestation with an oral glucose tolerance test (OGTT) showing fasting glucose of 109 mg/dl, 1-h glucose of 220 mg/dl, and 2-h glucose of 186 mg/dl. Insulin was started at 22 weeks gestation as dietary measures were insufficient. Post-delivery, her fasting glucose levels were normal.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Obesity with a body mass index of 31 kg/mÂ²; no other specified medical problems.
medical_history.family_history: Family history of diabetes mellitus in her mother, maternal aunt, and brother.
